meanings.definition: Becoming white or grayish due to age or maturity.
meanings.sent1: The old man's hair turned canescent as he aged.
meanings.sent2: The canescent clouds signaled the arrival of a storm.
meanings.sent3: The canescent cat looked wise beyond its years.
meanings.sent4: Her canescent thoughts reflected the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The canescent mountains stood as a testament to ancient wisdom.

meanings.definition: Covered with white or grayish hairs.
meanings.sent1: The canescent wolf blended perfectly with the snowy landscape.
meanings.sent2: The canescent fur of the rabbit provided excellent camouflage.
meanings.sent3: The canescent dog looked like a fluffy cloud on legs.
meanings.sent4: Her canescent mane flowed like a river of silver.
meanings.sent5: The canescent bear appeared almost ethereal in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: Having a whitish or grayish color.
meanings.sent1: The canescent walls of the old castle showed its age.
meanings.sent2: The canescent flowers added a touch of elegance to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The canescent sky at dawn painted a serene picture.
meanings.sent4: Her canescent dress shimmered in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The canescent mist enveloped the valley in a ghostly embrace.
